title: Maintain a Safe Following Distance
message: Keep at least a three-second gap between you and the car in front to allow enough time to react in case of sudden stops.

title: Use Turn Signals Early
message: Always signal your turns and lane changes well in advance to inform other drivers of your intentions.

title: Check Mirrors Frequently
message: Regularly glance at your rearview and side mirrors to stay aware of surrounding traffic conditions.

title: Avoid Sudden Braking
message: Brake smoothly and gradually whenever possible to maintain control and reduce wear on your brake pads.

title: Keep Both Hands on the Wheel
message: Maintain the '9 and 3' or '10 and 2' hand positions for maximum steering control.

title: Obey Speed Limits
message: Speed limits are designed for safety; follow them based on road, weather, and traffic conditions.

title: Avoid Distractions
message: Do not text, eat, or use your phone while driving. Focus entirely on the road.

title: Adjust Your Mirrors Before Driving
message: Ensure all mirrors are positioned to eliminate blind spots before you start moving.

title: Wear Your Seat Belt
message: Always buckle up before starting your vehicle — it can save your life in a crash.

title: Plan Your Route Ahead
message: Use GPS or a map to plan your route before starting your journey to avoid last-minute turns or confusion.

title: Don’t Drive When Tired
message: Fatigue slows reaction times and reduces focus; rest before driving if you feel drowsy.

title: Keep a Safe Speed in Rain
message: Wet roads reduce traction — slow down and avoid sudden maneuvers.

title: Avoid Tailgating
message: Following too closely gives you less time to react. Keep a safe distance at all times.

title: Use Headlights Wisely
message: Turn on your headlights at dusk, during rain, or in tunnels for better visibility.

title: Don’t Drive Under the Influence
message: Never drive after consuming alcohol or drugs that impair your judgment and reflexes.

title: Check Tire Pressure Regularly
message: Maintain correct tire pressure for better fuel efficiency, safety, and tire longevity.

title: Use Defensive Driving Techniques
message: Anticipate potential hazards and assume that other drivers might make mistakes.

title: Keep a Safe Speed on Curves
message: Slow down before entering curves to prevent skidding or losing control.

title: Use Parking Brakes on Inclines
message: Engage the parking brake when parked on a hill to prevent your car from rolling.

title: Check Blind Spots
message: Always check over your shoulder before changing lanes or merging.

title: Don’t Block Intersections
message: Only enter intersections when you’re sure you can clear them without stopping in the middle.

title: Keep Your Vehicle Maintained
message: Regularly service your car to ensure safe and efficient performance.

title: Be Patient with New Drivers
message: Give learners extra space and don’t honk or pressure them unnecessarily.

title: Watch for Pedestrians
message: Be extra cautious in crosswalks, near schools, and residential areas.

title: Avoid Road Rage
message: Stay calm and courteous, even if other drivers act aggressively.

title: Don’t Drive Too Slowly
message: Driving significantly below the speed limit can disrupt traffic and cause accidents.

title: Use Low Beams in Fog
message: High beams can reflect off fog and reduce visibility; use low beams instead.

title: Avoid Hard Acceleration
message: Accelerate smoothly to improve fuel efficiency and maintain control.

title: Respect Emergency Vehicles
message: Pull over to let ambulances, fire trucks, and police vehicles pass safely.

title: Keep Windows Clean
message: Dirty windows reduce visibility — clean them regularly inside and out.

title: Adjust Seat and Steering Position
message: Sit comfortably with a clear view of the road and easy access to pedals.

title: Check Weather Before Traveling
message: Plan your trips based on weather forecasts to avoid dangerous conditions.

title: Avoid Sudden Lane Changes
message: Always signal and check mirrors before switching lanes.

title: Use Cruise Control Wisely
message: On highways, use cruise control to maintain consistent speed and save fuel.

title: Stay in the Right Lane Unless Passing
message: Use the left lane only for overtaking, then return to the right.

title: Keep Both Eyes on the Road
message: Scanning the road ahead helps identify hazards early and prevents surprises.

title: Be Extra Careful at Night
message: Visibility decreases at night; slow down and stay alert for pedestrians and animals.

title: Avoid Puddles at High Speed
message: Driving fast through water can cause hydroplaning and loss of control.

title: Use Child Safety Seats Properly
message: Ensure car seats are correctly installed and suited for your child’s age and size.

title: Be Predictable
message: Avoid sudden moves; drive in a way others can anticipate your actions.

title: Inspect Lights Regularly
message: Ensure all headlights, brake lights, and turn signals work properly.

title: Don’t Ride the Clutch
message: Keep your foot off the clutch pedal unless you’re shifting gears to avoid wear.

title: Avoid Overloading Your Car
message: Carrying excessive weight reduces braking performance and fuel efficiency.

title: Look Far Ahead While Driving
message: Focus not just on the car in front but several vehicles ahead for early reaction.

title: Keep Emergency Supplies
message: Have a first aid kit, flashlight, jumper cables, and spare tire in your vehicle.

title: Use Handbrake on Slopes
message: Prevent rolling backward by engaging the handbrake on steep inclines.

title: Avoid Aggressive Driving
message: Sudden lane changes and tailgating increase accident risk and stress.

title: Stay Off the Shoulder
message: Only use the road shoulder for emergencies, not as a shortcut or passing lane.

title: Keep a Cool Temper
message: Anger affects judgment. Take deep breaths if frustrated behind the wheel.

title: Always Have Fuel Reserve
message: Avoid running your tank too low; it can damage the fuel pump and leave you stranded.

title: Respect Traffic Lights
message: Never run red lights — they’re a leading cause of serious collisions.

title: Avoid Using Headphones
message: Headphones block ambient sounds like sirens or horns, which can be dangerous.

title: Don’t Block Driveways
message: Be considerate and park responsibly without obstructing other vehicles.

title: Use Air Conditioning Wisely
message: At low speeds, open windows save fuel; at high speeds, AC is more efficient.

title: Stay Calm in Traffic Jams
message: Avoid weaving between lanes; stay patient and focused.

title: Avoid Flooded Roads
message: Never drive through deep water — it can stall your engine or sweep your car away.

title: Watch for Cyclists
message: Check mirrors and blind spots before opening your door or turning.

title: Avoid Driving Barefoot
message: Shoes provide better pedal control and safety.

title: Use Your Horn Sparingly
message: Only honk to alert others of danger, not out of frustration.

title: Avoid Sudden Steering Movements
message: Sharp turns at high speeds can cause loss of control.

title: Keep a Safe Distance from Trucks
message: Large vehicles have blind spots; don’t tailgate or linger beside them.

title: Use Proper Lane Discipline
message: Stay in your lane and signal before changing lanes or merging.

title: Check Fluid Levels Regularly
message: Ensure engine oil, coolant, and brake fluid are topped up to avoid breakdowns.

title: Be Cautious in Residential Areas
message: Drive slowly; children or pets may appear unexpectedly.

title: Adjust Speed in Heavy Traffic
message: Maintain a steady, slow pace to avoid frequent braking and acceleration.

title: Avoid Idling Too Long
message: Turn off your engine if stopped for more than a minute to save fuel.

title: Keep Headlights Aligned
message: Misaligned headlights reduce visibility and blind other drivers.

title: Never Reverse Without Looking
message: Turn your head and check mirrors carefully before backing up.

title: Stay Alert at Traffic Lights
message: Be prepared to move but check cross traffic before proceeding on green.

title: Don’t Drive in Flip-Flops
message: They can slip off and get stuck under the pedals.

title: Avoid Sudden Stops on Highways
message: If you must pull over, move completely off the road and use hazard lights.

title: Plan Rest Breaks on Long Trips
message: Stop every two hours to stretch and refresh your focus.

title: Use GPS Responsibly
message: Set your destination before driving, not while in motion.

title: Check Tire Tread Depth
message: Replace tires that have worn below safe tread limits to avoid skidding.

title: Avoid Bright Dashboard Lights at Night
message: Dim your dashboard to improve visibility and reduce glare.

title: Maintain Proper Posture
message: Sit upright with both hands on the wheel to reduce fatigue and improve control.

title: Avoid Using Rear Fog Lights in Clear Weather
message: They can dazzle drivers behind you; use them only in dense fog.

title: Keep Left on Multi-Lane Roads
message: Use the left lane for slower traffic and right lane for overtaking only.

title: Know Your Car’s Braking Distance
message: Understand how long it takes your car to stop under different conditions.

title: Avoid Driving with Low Visibility
message: If you can’t see well, pull over safely and wait until conditions improve.

title: Use Defoggers When Needed
message: Keep windows clear for maximum visibility during rain or cold weather.

title: Stay Focused at Intersections
message: Look both ways before proceeding, even on green.

title: Avoid Cruise Control in Heavy Rain
message: It can cause loss of traction during hydroplaning.

title: Be Careful on Gravel Roads
message: Reduce speed and avoid sudden turns to prevent skidding.

title: Avoid Overconfidence
message: Even experienced drivers should stay cautious and follow traffic rules.

title: Inspect Brakes Often
message: Listen for squealing or grinding noises; they signal brake wear.

title: Know Emergency Procedures
message: Learn how to handle skids, brake failure, or tire blowouts safely.

title: Keep Windshield Wipers Functional
message: Replace worn blades to maintain clear visibility during rain.

title: Use Turnouts to Let Others Pass
message: If traffic builds up behind you, pull aside to let faster vehicles pass.

title: Avoid Blocking the Fast Lane
message: If cars are overtaking you on the right, move over to the slower lane.

title: Drive Smoothly
message: Avoid jerky steering, acceleration, and braking for better fuel economy and comfort.

title: Keep Focus on the Road Ahead
message: Avoid staring at nearby distractions like billboards or accidents.

title: Respect Weather Conditions
message: Slow down during rain, fog, or snow to maintain traction and visibility.

title: Stay Calm After an Accident
message: Move to a safe area, check for injuries, and exchange information calmly.

title: Know the Right-of-Way Rules
message: Understanding who goes first helps prevent intersection collisions.

title: Avoid Resting Hand on Gear Lever
message: It adds pressure to transmission components; keep both hands on the wheel.

title: Avoid Heavy Braking on Downhill Roads
message: Use lower gears to control speed and prevent brake overheating.

title: Regularly Clean Your Headlights
message: Dirt and grime can reduce brightness by up to 50%.

title: Know Your Vehicle Dimensions
message: Understanding your car’s width and length helps with parking and tight spaces.

title: Avoid Using High Beams Near Other Cars
message: Dim your lights when approaching oncoming traffic to avoid blinding drivers.

title: Keep an Eye on the Fuel Gauge
message: Refuel before the tank runs too low to prevent engine or pump damage.

title: Anticipate Traffic Flow
message: Look ahead for brake lights or slow-moving vehicles to adjust speed early.
